derivation: from a compound of G3717 (ὀρθοτομέω) and the base of G5114 (ὀρθοτομέω), to make a straight cut, i.e. (figuratively) to dissect (expound) correctly (the divine message)
outline:
1. to cut straight, to cut straight ways
    1. to proceed on straight paths, hold a straight course, equiv. to doing right
  2. to make straight and smooth, to handle aright, to teach the truth directly and correctly
